intro: Gnaphalium rutidolepis, commonly known as the silverleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, silvery-gray foliage and small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its aromatic properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. The plant is also valued for its use in floral arrangements due to its long-lasting blooms and delicate appearance.
